executeMessage(bytes32,uint256,bytes,add.details: Must be called by MessageBug & sent from src chain by a trusted srcApp

params._executor: Address who called the MessageBus execution function
params._message: Arbitrary message bytes originated from and encoded by the source app contract
params._srcAddress: The bytes32 address of the source app contract
params._srcChainId: The source chain ID where the transfer is originated from

returns._0: status Enum containing options of Success, Fail, Retry

onERC721Received(address,address,uint256.details: Whenever an {IERC721} `tokenId` token is transferred to this contract via {IERC721-safeTransferFrom} by `operator` from `from`, this function is called. It must return its Solidity selector to confirm the token transfer. If any other value is returned or the interface is not implemented by the recipient, the transfer will be reverted. The selector can be obtained in Solidity with `onERC721Received.selector`.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._dstChainId: The destination chain ID - typically, standard EVM chain ID, but differs on nonEVM chains
params._heroId: specifics which hero msg.sender already holds and will transfer to the bridge contract

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: Core app for handling cross chain messaging passing to bridge Hero NFTs

executeMessage(bytes32,uint256,bytes,add.notice: Executes a message called by MessageBus (MessageBusReceiver)

sendHero(uint256,uint256).notice: User must have an existing hero minted to bridge it.
